response_requirements.initial_response_description: 5 business days to grant, deny, or extend
response_requirements.extension_conditions: Additional 5 business days with written notice for standard requests
response_requirements.commercial_request_notes: 21 working days for commercial requests, may extend additional 10 business days
response_requirements.voluminous_request_provisions: Additional time allowed for requests requiring compilation or extensive search

fee_structure.search_fee: May be charged for commercial requests only
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Search and review time may be charged for commercial requests
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: First 50 pages FREE; additional black and white copies $0.15 per page
fee_structure.fee_waiver_criteria: Available when disclosure serves the public interest or requestor's primary purpose is publication/broadcast

exemptions.description: Information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or state law
Private information including personal, medical, and financial details
Personal records maintained by public bodies concerning public employees
Records of law enforcement investigations or law enforcement proceedings
Preliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed or policies formulated
Trade secrets and commercial or financial information obtained from a person or business
Information received by a primary or secondary school, college, or university in confidence
Library circulation and order records identifying library users

appeal_process.first_level: Public Access Counselor (PAC) - Office of the Attorney General
appeal_process.first_level_deadline_notes: Must request PAC review within 60 days of denial
appeal_process.first_level_notes: PAC provides binding determination with limited exceptions - unique feature of Illinois law
appeal_process.pac_contact: Public Access Counselor, Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 500 S. 2nd Street, Springfield, IL 62701
appeal_process.second_level: Circuit Court - Injunctive or declaratory relief
appeal_process.second_level_deadline_notes: No specific statutory deadline for filing court action
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award reasonable attorney's fees and costs to prevailing requester
appeal_process.civil_penalties_notes: Civil penalties for willful and intentional violations

requester_requirements.purpose_statement_exception: Public bodies may require purpose statement for commercial requests only
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Request must be in writing (including electronic submission)
requester_requirements.specific_format: Must clearly identify the records sought; no standard form required
requester_requirements.submission_methods: Personal delivery, mail, fax, or email accepted

agency_obligations.electronic_submission_required: Public bodies must accept electronic requests
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Must provide records in electronic format when requested; cannot require specific software to access records
agency_obligations.redaction_requirements: Must redact personal information before disclosure
agency_obligations.presumption_of_openness: All records in custody or possession of public body are presumed to be open to inspection or copying
agency_obligations.balancing_test: Privacy vs. public interest balancing test applies
agency_obligations.meeting_recordings_required: Audio recordings of open meetings must be made available

oversight_body.name: Public Access Counselor (PAC)
oversight_body.role: Provides binding administrative determinations on FOIA disputes
oversight_body.contact_info: Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 500 S. 2nd Street, Springfield, IL 62701

official_resources.request_portal_notes: Each agency maintains its own FOIA contact and submission process

primary_sources: 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. (Illinois Freedom of Information Act)
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Illinois statute. Response times: 5 business days standard, 21 working days for commercial requests. First 50 pages FREE (unique feature). Public Access Counselor provides BINDING administrative determinations (rare among states). Civil penalties $2,500-$5,000 for willful violations. Electronic format must be provided when requested.
unique_characteristics: First 50 pages of copies are FREE
Public Access Counselor provides binding administrative determinations
Independent oversight body (PAC) within Attorney General's office
Separate timelines for commercial vs. standard requests
